trans-unit.source: How to deploy apps | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: How to deploy apps | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the information in this topic to help you deploy apps with Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in this topic to help you deploy apps with Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the information in this topic to help you deploy apps with Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in this topic to help you deploy apps with Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: Deploy an app
trans-unit.target: Deploy an app

trans-unit.source: In this procedure, you'll deploy an app to selected groups of devices or users.
trans-unit.target: In this procedure, you'll deploy an app to selected groups of devices or users.

trans-unit.source: To deploy an app
trans-unit.target: To deploy an app

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), click **Apps** > **Apps** to view the list of apps that you manage.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), click **Apps** > **Apps** to view the list of apps that you manage.

trans-unit.source: Select the app that you want to deploy, and then click **Manage Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: Select the app that you want to deploy, and then click **Manage Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: In the *<app name>* dialog box, on the **Select Groups** page, choose the user or device groups to which you want to deploy the app.
trans-unit.target: In the *<app name>* dialog box, on the **Select Groups** page, choose the user or device groups to which you want to deploy the app.

trans-unit.source: On the **Deployment Action** page, configure the following:
trans-unit.target: On the **Deployment Action** page, configure the following:

trans-unit.source: **Approval** - Choose whether the deployment is:
trans-unit.target: **Approval** - Choose whether the deployment is:

trans-unit.source: **Required** (mandatory install)
trans-unit.target: **Required** (mandatory install)

trans-unit.source: **Available** (users install from the company portal on demand)
trans-unit.target: **Available** (users install from the company portal on demand)

trans-unit.source: **Not Applicable** (the app is not installed or shown in the company portal)
trans-unit.target: **Not Applicable** (the app is not installed or shown in the company portal)

trans-unit.source: **Uninstall** (the app is uninstalled from targeted devices)
trans-unit.target: **Uninstall** (the app is uninstalled from targeted devices)

trans-unit.source: **Deadline** - For required installations, choose how soon to deploy the app.
trans-unit.target: **Deadline** - For required installations, choose how soon to deploy the app.

trans-unit.source: You can choose from the predefined values, or you can select **Custom** to configure your own deadline.
trans-unit.target: You can choose from the predefined values, or you can select **Custom** to configure your own deadline.

trans-unit.source: If the app you are deploying can be configured by a mobile application management policy, the **Mobile App Management** page is displayed.
trans-unit.target: If the app you are deploying can be configured by a mobile application management policy, the **Mobile App Management** page is displayed.

trans-unit.source: On this page, choose the mobile application management policy that you want to associate with this app.
trans-unit.target: On this page, choose the mobile application management policy that you want to associate with this app.

trans-unit.source: [See which Microsoft apps are compatible with mobile application management policies.](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/microsoft-intune/partners.aspx)
trans-unit.target: [See which Microsoft apps are compatible with mobile application management policies.](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/microsoft-intune/partners.aspx)

trans-unit.source: If the app you are deploying is compatible with Intune VPN profiles, the **VPN Profile** page is displayed.
trans-unit.target: If the app you are deploying is compatible with Intune VPN profiles, the **VPN Profile** page is displayed.

trans-unit.source: On this page, you can choose to associate iOS apps with a VPN profile that you have deployed.
trans-unit.target: On this page, you can choose to associate iOS apps with a VPN profile that you have deployed.

trans-unit.source: The VPN connection automatically opens when the app is launched.
trans-unit.target: The VPN connection automatically opens when the app is launched.

trans-unit.source: To make a VPN profile available, it must have the **Per-app VPN** profile setting enabled.
trans-unit.target: To make a VPN profile available, it must have the **Per-app VPN** profile setting enabled.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to configure VPN profiles, including information about how to associate profiles with apps, see [VPN connections in Microsoft Intune](vpn-connections-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about how to configure VPN profiles, including information about how to associate profiles with apps, see [VPN connections in Microsoft Intune](vpn-connections-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: In this example, you deployed the app as **Available** to an iOS device.
trans-unit.target: In this example, you deployed the app as **Available** to an iOS device.

trans-unit.source: The app displays on users' devices in the company portal, and users can install it from there.
trans-unit.target: The app displays on users' devices in the company portal, and users can install it from there.

trans-unit.source: For example, in this screenshot, the Bing for iOS app was deployed by using the **External Link** installation type with a custom icon.
trans-unit.target: For example, in this screenshot, the Bing for iOS app was deployed by using the **External Link** installation type with a custom icon.

trans-unit.source: The option **Display this as a featured app and highlight it in the company portal** was selected.
trans-unit.target: The option **Display this as a featured app and highlight it in the company portal** was selected.

trans-unit.source: ![iOS available app](./media/available-install-on-iOS.png)
trans-unit.target: ![iOS available app](./media/available-install-on-iOS.png)

trans-unit.source: If you deployed the app as **Required** to an iOS device, the user will get a notification that an app is ready to install.
trans-unit.target: If you deployed the app as **Required** to an iOS device, the user will get a notification that an app is ready to install.

trans-unit.source: For example, in this screenshot, the Work Folders for iOS app was deployed by using the **Managed iOS app from the app store** installation type.
trans-unit.target: For example, in this screenshot, the Work Folders for iOS app was deployed by using the **Managed iOS app from the app store** installation type.

trans-unit.source: ![iOS required app](./media/iOS-Required-install.PNG)
trans-unit.target: ![iOS required app](./media/iOS-Required-install.PNG)

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: After you deploy an app, you'll want to monitor its progress.
trans-unit.target: After you deploy an app, you'll want to monitor its progress.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Monitor apps in Microsoft Intune](monitor-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Monitor apps in Microsoft Intune](monitor-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md).
